title: How to end a conclusion in an essay - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on what you are trying to do. If you’re showing off how much you know to a prof, then you follow the classic “This is what I just told” summary of your paper, perhaps drawing a new conclusion or two there, or showing relationships that might warrant further investigation. If its to persuade, then nail the reasons you’re right. If appropriate, end with a call to action for the reader to do something. If it’s science, this is the place to discuss the meanings of the research and results, which also tends to tie this knowledge up with what is already known, and could suggest places for further investigation. this is the place to reconfirm what you asserted in the opening.

Your conclusion should · Summarise key points of essay – what have you done, what key points have you found in your essay? Focus on areas of importance but try not to replicate what you have written. Possibly identify areas which still require further exploration. Does this help you?
